New Records: Jaylen Brown became the fourth player in franchise history to have at least 40 points and at least four steals in a regular-season game
Key Match Events: Brown scored a season-high 44 points in Boston's 142-105 victory over Indiana
Indiana was outshot 51.1 percent to 41.8 percent from the field
Pre-Game Insights: Indiana head coach Rick Carlisle emphasized the need for the team to play better
Payton Pritchard highlighted Jaylen Brown's defensive abilities and suggested he should be in the All-Defensive Team category
Post-Match Reflections: Jaylen Brown expressed his defensive philosophy and emphasized the importance of being a two-way player
Tyrese Haliburton acknowledged the team's struggles against Boston and expressed optimism about the rematch
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sunday's matchup will be the third and final game between the teams during the regular season
The Pacers won the first meeting 135-132 in overtime on Oct. 30
Others: The article provides a game preview for the upcoming matchup between the Boston Celtics and the Indiana Pacers
